poem:
**Echoes of '64**  

The pages turn on a morning mist,
Raindrop shadows on broadsheet print.
Starmer stands where Wilson stood,
Polaroids fading into pixels,
Promises ricochet in Parliament halls.
Economies sway,
a waltz with history,
while we sip tea,
optimism cupped in our hands,
like a trembling sparrow,
just briefly warmed.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. A sense in the country that something has gone seriously wrong with the economy and that change is needed. A backdrop of rapid technological change. For 2024, read 1964. For Sir Keir Starmer, read Harold Wilson. Wilson came". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
